newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: PRESS DIGEST - South Africa - Oct 3.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - South Africa - Oct 3.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the South African press on Thursday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Community Bank staff have been issued with retrenchment letters and the beleaguered institution is expected to begin closing at the end of the month.
- First National Bank is reconsidering the market positioning of its retail, corporate and merchant banking operations, less than a year after a major group restructuring.
- The ANC dropped its opposition to policing being a provincial power and said in private talks with other parties in the Constitutional Assembly that it is willing to compromise.
- The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), the main U.S. financial regulator, has warned that quid pro quo asset swaps between South African and U.S. institutions contravenes the law.
- Thebe Investment and Swedish partner ID Kort are crying foul over the award of a 254 million rand tender to make a new credit-card style drivers' licence to Image Database Technologies.

- Servgro chairman Peet van der Walt moved to quash speculation that Teljoy, which is 48 percent owned by Servgro, was considering disinvesting its cellular phone interests or unbundling its operations.
- Constitutional negotiators meeting in parliament adopted limits on the powers of local government to levy rates and taxes.
- More than 500 people were left homeless and at least five people were injured when about 100 shacks were destroyed by fire in Tembisa's Madelakufa squatter camp.
- The worst fire in 40 years has ravaged a quarter of the Kruger National Park and killed many animals.
